Articles.Content:
I have a similar problem. It just doesn't seem to matter what I set the volume sliders to on chatterer, I've even set them at 0%, but it doesn't seem to matter. The volume is just so in consistent, one minute it is at a nice volume the other minute it is screaming in my ears. Only the beeps are consistent. I freakin love the mod, which is the only reason I put up with it. I came to the thread hoping there was a patch to fix it.

I even have the application volume lowered to 10% in the window sound applet. KSP sound in general are inconsistent, but the mod is severely so.

I also run borderless window. The only way that "seems" consistent is by changing the sliders each time I enter a ship.

Ok,

I just tried Chatterer on a vanilla KSP, I can't reproduce this volume issue.

Can you give this a try :

- delete the "...\Kerbal Space Program\GameData\Chatterer\Plugins\PluginData\Chatterer\plugin.cfg" file,

(the mod will create a fresh new one upon next load)

- try to load/switch to different vessels and see if issue is gone,

- make sure to not enable "per-vessel settings" option.

Sounds volume should be (and be kept) as follow :

- Chatter : 80%

- Beeps : 30%

EDIT : (by default)

Hope this helps.

Edited March 30, 2014 by Athlonic

Um...why keep the sound volume at these levels, Athlonic?

To my understanding the plugin's volume for voices does not comply with KSP's "Voices" sound level bar. So I have manually turned down Chatter volumes to 20%(same as my voices(and all other sounds of KSP for that matter)).

The issue that we(or atleast me) have is that Chatterer does not seem to care whether I set its own Chatter and beep volume to 20%. The first time I switch to a vehicle - the volume is probably 100% even if the bar shows 20%. The moment I touch the bar, even during transmission, the volume immediately goes down to the selected level and stays this way until i switch craft again.

Oh I meant 80% and 30% by default, my bad.

But if you change it to 10-20% it should stay at your desired volume if you switch vessel, as long as you don't enable the "Per-vessel setting".
I had the Communotron 2.5Mm omni antenna attached to my capsule and it had a good link to my satellites and down to MC yet when I enabled RT2 integration it kept telling me there was no signal

Yep.

There is no RT2 integration ... yet.

As you now mantain Chatterer , how about with next version you make a new thread? I don't know how often iannic-ann-od still checks into the forums but it would be easier to change the OP Maybe make a single thread for both LCD and Chatterer
Ooops, my bad I sometimes forget there's a difference between RemoteTech (what is says in the Settings) and RemoteTech2

Sorry if this has been asked already, but is this going to need an update now that 23.5 is out?

I'm getting no breathing or airlock sounds, except for one ship which decided to start breathing even when there were no kerbals in it.

I also see this happening. I just tested a simple one man capsule with Jeb in it and going on EVA, using build 0.5.9.2 on an up to date KSP from Steam. The radio chatter seemed to work fine, but there were no airlock or breathing sounds, here is the relevant part of KSP.log:

I've been using it for some time, and it's wonderful.

Assuming you had specially-recorded clips of speech in actually Kerbalnese or whatever it's called, would it be possible to have different voices play during different situations? So like during the launch or landing the chattering becomes slightly more frequent and the voices sound a bit more tense, when nothing is really happening it's casual and calm, and when something explodes you can hear them screaming in uncontrollable panic?
Got here from the Launch CountDown mod, I was excited when I saw that one, now I'm absolutely psyched!! This looks amazing! Can't wait to try it out!

I wonder if some of the perceived volume issues may be due to the Russian audio samples being twice as loud as the Apollo or STS1 samples. Try simply turning off the Russian recordings and see if that sounds better.
if the files themsleves are louder than each other people should tweak the game's audio normalizer in the settings

I wonder if some of the perceived volume issues may be due to the Russian audio samples being twice as loud as the Apollo or STS1 samples. Try simply turning off the Russian recordings and see if that sounds better.

Good one.

It is true Russian voices are like they scream like mad in their mic.

If this turns to be the volume issue some people have, I may re-balance them in the next update.

Let me know.

Also, I will see if I can fix the 0.23.5 missing airlock/breath sound issue, looks like Squad changed EVA state somehow...

Downloaded and installed yesterday for the first time. What now has me hooked is as I landed on the Mun in FASA'S Lunar Module I got what sounded like a kerbalized version of "The Eagle has landed". EPIC!

Changelog:

v0.5.9.3:

- Recompiled for KSP v0.23.5 (fixes missing Airlock/Breath sounds)

- Added Debug Mode setting (disabled by default, so Chatterer no more spam your Log)

- Disabled "Remotech integration" & "Check for update" settings as they don't work (for now)

Believe it or not but a simple recompile with 0.23.5 references fixed the missing Airlock & Breathing sounds ! OO

Even if my C# IDE didn't show any error/warning messages.

Lesson learned : Always recompile your Mods when a new KSP update is out.

Here is the link : Dropbox : Chatterer_0.5.9.3.zip
Hope the sound level discrepancies have fixed themselves too.
Is there any way to make the background noise disappear when you are in a vacuum in "3rd person" view? That would be nice. Thanks for the breathing and airlock fix BTW.

Good one.

If this turns to be the volume issue some people have, I may re-balance them in the next update.

Let me know.

Again, the game has its own normalizer. I haven't noticed any voices being louder than one another and my voices are at 100% while the rest of the game audio is balanced lower. I can't remember whether the audio normalizer is switched on by default or not. It's in the main settings window under the audio section.

Hey Athlonic,

is it possible to add more soundclips, to have a bigger variaty of chattering on mission?
Lost my chatterer Icon on the Toolbar any idea on how to fix I dislike the toolbar immensly

Lost my chatterer Icon on the Toolbar any idea on how to fix I dislike the toolbar immensly

You can remove the toolbar if you'd like. If you need help using it, I suggest you ask in the toolbar thread. There's an arrow on the right hand side of the toolbar. Click that and click "configure visible buttons". Make Chatterer visible.

... . ... ...... ... ...... ... ... ... ..... .............. ... .. . ... ...... ... .. ..... .. .... ........ ... ....... ... . . ....... .... ... ...... .. ... .. .. .. ..... . . . . ........ . . . .

......... . . . . . ................ . . . ................... . . . . .

..

Did that and all i get is a black square for chatterer everyone is putting toolbar integration in and forgetting some people dont use it or want it. I have solved the problem the texture compressor was screwing the icon over removed the config for it and its back sorry to trouble you all

Edited April 7, 2014 by Virtualgenius

Did that and all i get is a black square for chatterer everyone is putting toolbar integration in and forgetting some people dont use it or want it. I have solved the problem the texture compressor was screwing the icon over removed the config for it and its back sorry to trouble you all

Everyone's putting it in because it's a vastly superior solution to having buttons scattered everywhere or having one annoying button that never moves that is suddenly on top of a button that Squad moved in an update.

Also, there's going to be a stock Toolbar in 0.24. There's really no getting away from it.

For 2 buttons its not worth the effort and thanks for giving me the good news, another toolbar thats awesome I will look forward to that NOT. I have sabotaged this thread long enough I love chatterer what can we look forward to in the world of chatterer.
